metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5943 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Request Tracker (RT) 4.x before 4.0.25, 4.2.x before 4.2.14, and 4.4.x before 4.4.2 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information about cross-site request forgery (CSRF) verification tokens via a crafted URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.4.1-4
rt4-apache2 - 4.4.1-4
rt4-clients - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-mysql - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.4.1-4
rt4-fcgi - 4.4.1-4
rt4-standalone - 4.4.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-4').
